Title: Creating Tourism Surety in Economically Challenging Times
Venue: Caribbean Seminar: Best Practices in Public/Private Sector Cooperation – Enhancing Tourism Competitiveness
Disciplines: Tourism & hospitality management; Risk management; Crisis & emergency management; Security & law enforcement; Public–private partnership
Audience: Tourism officials, law enforcement, security managers, policy makers
Abstract: Practical guidance on balancing tourism safety, risk management, and marketing; argues that visible, authentic security increases visitor confidence and destination competitiveness.
Key_Takeaways: Visible security builds trust; Distinguish risk vs crisis; Create cross-sector task forces; Train police in tourism; Prioritize real over cosmetic security.
Actionable_Items: Form tourism security task force; Create community security brochure; Train TOPS officers; Conduct security audits; Develop crisis playbooks.
Methods: Seminar-based presentation integrating applied examples and conceptual distinctions between risk and crisis management.
Keywords: tourism security, crisis management, PPP, visible policing, CPTED, hospitality safety

Title: Religion, Violence and Terrorism
Disciplines: Sociology of religion; Terrorism studies; Political science; Ethics
Audience: Researchers, policy analysts, religious studies scholars
Abstract: Examines links between religion and violence, arguing that while religion can be a factor in terrorism, socio-political and psychological variables are equally significant.
Key_Takeaways: Avoid mono-causal explanations; Religion can both promote peace and justify violence; Terrorism is sociopolitical, not purely theological.
Actionable_Items: Encourage multidisciplinary study; Integrate ethics into counter-terror training; Foster interfaith dialogue for prevention.
Methods: Qualitative comparative analysis of historical and contemporary examples of religious violence.
Keywords: religion, terrorism, ethics, violence, ideology, radicalization

Title: Do Loyalty Programs Work?

Keywords: loyalty programs, marketing, hospitality, travel, consumer behavior
